subject: Re: [junit] assertException
msgSnippet: Yosef, I think I can see what you d like to do, and I can tell you that JUnit does not support it natively.  Also, I m not sure exactly what the semantics of
messageBody:
Yosef,

I think I can see what you'd like to do, and I can tell you that JUnit
does not support it natively. Also, I'm not sure exactly what the
semantics of that test would be. For example, what if s[4] threw an
ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException, but s[5] did not? What if none of the
array accesses threw a ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException, but println
did?

David Saff

On Thu, Sep 4, 2008 at 1:32 AM, yosefshariat <yosefshariat@...> wrote:
> Hello
> I write a unit test where must be Exception.
> Also I need to run this unit test for few status
> and don't want create again my unit test for each status
> , and I want don't terminated a unit test after throws exception
> and be run until end of unit test.
>
> For example:
> public class TestWithException
> {
> @Test(expected = ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException.class)
> public void TestWithException()
> {
> String[] s ={"1","2","3"};
> System.out.println(s[4]);
> System.out.println("1");
>
> System.out.println(s[5]);
> System.out.println("2");
>
> System.out.println(s[6]);
> System.out.println("3");
> }
> }
>
>
